image.altText: A building is crushed after an earthquake in Port Vila

props.synopsis: An earthquake of magnitude 6.1 struck the Vanuatu islands early this morning after a magnitude-7.3 quake yesterday. Follow live.

title.children: Another earthquake hits Vanuatu as death toll expected to rise

image.altText: A man and woman, both smiling, sit at an outdoors table reading.

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers will deliver the mid-year update this morning.

title.children: Budget 'sunshine' turns cloudy as deficits return, mid-year update to show

image.altText: Hugh Marks

props.synopsis: Hugh Marks's ascension to the top of the media pile was not via the traditional route. Now he has one of Australia's toughest assignments.

title.children: Hugh Marks merged Nine and Fairfax. Now he's poised to lead the ABC

image.altText: A middle-aged bald man in a military uniform speaks while seated behind a name plaque.

props.synopsis: Lieutenant General Igor Kirillov, who served as chief of Russia's nuclear defence forces, was recently accused by Ukraine of being responsible for the use of chemical weapons against Ukrainian troops.

title.children: Ukraine behind 'bomb in scooter' assassination of top Russian general

image.altText: Generic photo of people swimming in the ocean at an Adelaide beach on a hot day.

props.synopsis: Christmas Day is looking dry and sunny for most of the country, with a distinctive lack of rain-producing low-pressure systems, troughs or cold fronts appearing on the charts.

title.children: Christmas Day forecast promises sunshine for most of Australia

image.altText: A spinning 3D globe with yellow and red spikes jutting out from major solar regions

props.synopsis: Satellite imagery reveals the staggering rise of solar farms around the world in recent years. Can Australia get on board?

title.children: A planet-wide solar boom is beating expectations at every turn

image.altText: Hands holding bottle of ArmaForce.

props.synopsis: Australia's Therapeutic Goods Administration has an ongoing investigation into a key ingredient of ArmaForce, which is believed to have triggered several adverse reactions.

title.children: Popular cold and flu treatment ArmaForce under investigation by TGA

image.altText: Pat Cummins walks off the Gabba with his teammates behind him

props.synopsis: Australia arrived at the Gabba on day four needing to force the issue for everything to fall their way for a victory to be snatched, but as the misfortunes piled up the day quickly came to represent a missed opportunity.

title.children: On a day where Australia needed everything to go right, too much went wrong

image.altText: Brunette haired woman with bandage over missing nose

props.synopsis: In Australia, anyone needing a facial prosthetic, such as a nose or ear, must pay for it themselves. However, those below the neck can be paid for through government funding or private health insurance.

title.children: Cancer survivors facing 'debilitating' stigma fight for prosthetics funding

image.altText: Several people sleeping and lying on floor in prison

props.synopsis: Under proposed law changes, drug users in Indonesia could be sent to rehabilitation centres instead of prison. But legal experts say the change will simply shift a problem.

title.children: Indonesia signals shift in penalties for drug users

image.altText: Police in hazmat suits in bushland investigating.

props.synopsis: The second body has been found near where a 33-year-old woman's remains were discovered wrapped in a plastic bag near Sydney Airport last week.

title.children: Police treating discovery of second body in Botany as 'targeted double murder'

image.altText: A ship in the ocean.

props.synopsis: Japanese officials claim their Mogami frigate is faster, stealthier and better suited to operate alongside the United States than a rival warship offering from Germany.

title.children: Faster and stealthier: Japan's pitch to clinch $10bn Australian warship prize

image.altText: The region spanning the sky from the constellation of Sagittarius (the Archer) to Scorpius (the Scorpion).

props.synopsis: A group of international researchers discover a binary star orbiting near a supermassive black hole at the centre of our galaxy, the Milky Way.

title.children: Binary star found orbiting supermassive black hole at galaxy's centre

image.altText: Debris and corrugated iron sheeting cluttering a street alongside damaged buildings

props.synopsis: More than 200 Red Cross humanitarian workers are feared missing in the wake of the worst cyclone to hit the French territory of Mayotte in 90 years.

title.children: Cyclone Chido death toll rises as Red Cross volunteers feared missing

image.altText: The red Qantas kanmgaroo logo seen on the tail of a white Boeing 767 plane on a background of a blue sky

props.synopsis: Qantas and the Transport Workers Union have agreed to set up a compensation fund for payments to be sent to 1,820 impacted former employees who were outsourced by the airline.

title.children: Qantas agrees to $120m in compensation for illegally sacked workers

image.altText: Snoop Dogg wears sunglasses and holds his fingers together as if smoking.

props.synopsis: It's been 31 years since Snoop Dogg and Dr. Dre teamed up on the former's debut. Their latest reunion doesn't quite hit as hard.

title.children: After 30 years, Snoop pulls Dr. Dre back in to produce his new album

image.altText: Peter Dutton speaks at a press conference in brisbane

props.synopsis: Details of the coming promise to voters, which follows months of consultation with the gas industry, are being calibrated to counter Labor's likely strategy of ongoing direct-to-households energy bill relief.

title.children: Dutton to revive Morrison's 'gas-fired recovery' in election pledge to cut energy bills

image.altText: An older man in a suit stares off to the side

props.synopsis: Mr Marks gives his first major interview following his appointment to the role of ABC managing director, taking over from David Anderson.

title.children: Controversies at Nine 'remain a shock' to former chief Hugh Marks ahead of ABC move

image.altText: A close up of a man wearing a suit speaking.

props.synopsis: The university sector is preparing for a controversial visa processing direction to be replaced before the end of the year despite the education minister previously vowing it would remain in place until international student caps could be enforced.

title.children: Controversial international student direction expected to be replaced

image.altText: Police outside a protest in Melbourne's CBD

props.synopsis: Bans on face masks, the seizure of attachment devices, and restrictions on protests near places of worship are all being planned by the Victorian government.

title.children: Victoria will reform its laws around protesting. Here's what's changing

image.altText: Man smiling at camera

props.synopsis: Japanese authorities had issued an international warrant for Paul Watson's arrest earlier this year, alleging he injured a Japanese ship's crew member with a stink bomb in 2010.

title.children: Sea Shepherd founder released from detention in Greenland

image.altText: An aerial view of resort buildings with a swimming pool and palm trees on the ocean.

props.synopsis: Health authorities are investigating following the hospitalisation of six people who became critically ill after drinking cocktails in tropical Fiji.

title.children: 'Pre-packaged' pina colada, six left critically ill: What we now know about the Fiji poisoning

image.altText: Students sit and listen in a theatre.

props.synopsis: More than 130 high achievers have been celebrated for achieving first or equal results in HSC subjects in NSW with four students topping more than one course.

title.children: More than 130 HSC high achievers celebrated at ceremony in Sydney

image.altText: A blue Meta logo placed on the keyboard of a silver laptop

props.synopsis: Facebook's parent company has agreed to a landmark payment over the Cambridge Analytica privacy scandal.

title.children: Meta agrees to pay Australian Facebook users in $50 million settlement

image.altText: Houses under construction on a bright, sunny day

props.synopsis: New Treasury figures show the top tenth of earners are hauling in tens of billions of dollars from tax concessions and loopholes.

title.children: One million Australians are negatively gearing, new tax figures show

image.altText: a truck parked in front of the fires

props.synopsis: Water-bombing aircraft have been called in to fight two out-of control bushfires, with a leave now message issued for nearby communities.

title.children: Leave now warnings issued for out of control bushfire in Victoria

image.altText: A young man with short cropped hair and a neck tattoo wears a blue football jersey.

props.synopsis: Premier League club Chelsea issues a brief statement confirming an investigation into Ukrainian international Mykhailo Mudryk after an adverse result from a urine sample.

title.children: Chelsea's Mykhailo Mudryk returns adverse result on anti-doping test

image.altText: Two men in suits smiling, while holding glasses of wine and looking at each other

props.synopsis: Ukraine's military intelligence agency and the Pentagon say about 30 North Korean troops were killed or wounded during a battle with the Ukrainian army.

title.children: First North Korean deaths reported in Russia-Ukraine conflict

image.altText: Heat makes for restless nights

props.synopsis: Public life ground to a halt, many lost power, and scores of people died behind closed doors. What sounds like the start of a post-apocalyptic movie is in fact Melbourne in January 2009.

title.children: Australia's deadliest natural disaster flew under the radar but killed hundreds

image.altText: A Mobil sign near fuel bowsers

props.synopsis: The consumer watchdog alleges fuel sold at several service stations in Queensland did not contain additives which the company claimed would protect customers' engines.

title.children: Mobil says it regrets misleading customers as ACCC launches legal action

image.altText: An emergency vehicle behind police tape and a school sign.

props.synopsis: A school shooting in Wisconsin was the 323rd in the US this year. Here's what the data tells us about the shooters, the victims and which states are worst-hit.

title.children: In numbers: 2024 US school shootings second-highest since 1966

image.altText: A black and white image of a man working over some drinks.

props.synopsis: A Perth dentist who spiked the drinks of multiple women he met on dating apps and then sexually assaulted them is sentenced to 15 years in jail.

title.children: Dentist to spend 15 years in jail for drugging, assaulting women he met online

image.altText: Blurred Graffiti under bridge in Sefton

props.synopsis: In his first media interview, Australia's Special Envoy to Combat Islamophobia has described the targeting of Muslims as a "hidden cancer".

title.children: Islamic leader says 'very public display of hate' reflects many abhorrent messages

image.altText: A window with the words law courts printed on it

props.synopsis: After hearing concerns over his plans for revenge, violence, and tampering with his monitoring device, the NSW Supreme Court has refused to release a man convicted of murdering a child on the Central Coast.

title.children: Child murderer remains behind bars after court hears of revenge plans

image.altText: A line-up of cars on a road that is partially underwater.

props.synopsis: Parts of Queensland have been submerged by flash flooding — and there is more rain to come.

title.children: Queensland faces both heavy rain and heatwave
